title: Ticket #1408: Purge code for supporting "old" config files (STARTER/SHADOW_LIST)
description:
A few places in the code still param for SBIN, which is bad. The more legit places are apparently for config files pre 2002.

VERSION HISTORY: Condor will no longer look for the standard universe shadow or starter in SBIN if they are not included in the SHADOW/STARTER_LIST configuration macros. This should only be an issue for users with config files pre-2002.
remarks:
2010-May-15 12:10:34 by matt:
The configuration in question is an explicit need for STARTER_LIST and SHADOW_LIST

2010-May-15 12:10:52 by matt: 
commit 7e58a5efecb5e9671b0284391a96726deed6598a
Author: wright <wright>
Date:   Fri Apr 19 20:46:17 2002 +0000

    added the ShadowMgr and Shadow classes.  ShadowMgr which deals with
    the SHADOW_LIST config file setting.  at startup and reconfig it
    spawns all the shadows specified there (for backwards compatibility,
    if SHADOW_LIST isn't defined it just tries all the old names that
    might be in your config file) with the -classad option, and grabs
    their classads.  it is responsible for finding a Shadow object that
    matches a given job's needs when the schedd needs to spawn a shadow.
    This stuff is based heavily on the StarterMgr and Starter objects in
    the startd, so if you fix anything here, you should check there, too.


commit cfb0c0eb5d6da5729caa4def18462627280895ae
Author: wright <wright>
Date:   Fri Apr 19 20:41:27 2002 +0000

    a few more changes to help w/ supporting old config files:
    - dprintf a warning if we discover an old config file to encourage
      people to fix theirs to the new way (only print it once).
    - if we're dealing w/ an old file, we're not going to find the new
      condor_starter.std binary which we now ship.  so, special-case that
      one and search in SBIN for it.
